entries.title: House Republicans Move Ahead With Effort to Oust Omar from Panel
entries.description: The US House is preparing to vote this week on a resolution that would remove Democrat Ilhan Omar from the Foreign Affairs Committee as Speaker Kevin McCarthy convinced at least two Republican holdouts to support the move.

entries.title: India Budget to Target Growth, Smaller Fiscal Gap Amid Adani Woes
entries.description: India is set to unveil a budget that will chart a path for sustained robust growth and fiscal prudence although the fallout from Hindenburg Research’s allegations on the Adani Group poses an overhang on the presentation.

entries.title: Feinstein’s Donors Are Already Doubting Whether She’ll Run in California Senate Race
entries.description: California Senator Dianne Feinstein said she will announce whether to run for her seat in the spring. Donors are already saying she won’t.

entries.title: National Archives Releases Records Tied to Trump Classified Documents
entries.description: The National Archives and Records Administration released a cache of documents related to its retrieval of 15 boxes of presidential records improperly stored at Mar-a-Lago by former President Donald Trump.

entries.title: Baseball’s Antitrust Exemption Is ‘Dubious,’ Needs Limits, US Says
entries.description: Major League Baseball’s century-old antitrust exemption is “of dubious validity” and should not be expanded by the courts, the Biden administration argued in a legal case by a group of minor league teams.

entries.title: Covid’s Quiet Creep in Japan Fuels Its Deadliest Outbreak Yet
entries.description: Japan is no longer the best-performing wealthy nation when it comes to avoiding Covid deaths.

entries.title: Chief: Fatal shooting at LA home was 'targeted assault'
entries.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A weekend shooting in which three women were killed at a short-term rental home in an upscale Los Angeles neighborhood was a targeted attack, the city's police chief said Tuesday as investigators continued to search for suspects.

entries.title: Texas AG Paxton Is in Settlement Talks With Aides Who Reported Him to FBI
entries.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has entered into settlement discussions with three former aides who claim he fired them for reporting bribery and other misconduct to the FBI.

entries.title: House GOP to Huddle on Debt Ahead of McCarthy-Biden Meeting
entries.description: House Republicans will meet privately Wednesday morning to discuss their strategy on the debt ceiling, just hours before Speaker Kevin McCarthy and President Joe Biden discuss the looming crisis, a GOP aide said.

entries.title: Made-in-India GE Jet Engines Sought in Closer US Security Ties
entries.description: The US and India plan to share advanced defense and computing technology, including the potential joint production of General Electric Co. jet engines, as the Biden administration seeks to shift New Delhi away from Russia and counter China.

entries.title: US Sets Up Dispute Panel on Canadian Dairy Quotas Under Trade Deal
entries.description: The US set up a second dispute-settlement panel to resolve differences with Canada over its dairy quotas, saying Ottawa is still undermining access to its market under a trade deal between the nations.

entries.title: Fed Tightens Rules to Limit Its Employees’ Political Advocacy
entries.description: Federal Reserve officials quietly tightened internal restrictions on employees’ political activities after several reserve banks ran afoul of Congress over real or perceived engagement on issues within the domain of elected officials.

entries.title: Trump’s ‘False Denials’ in Fraud Suit Merit Sanctions, NY Says
entries.description: New York’s attorney general said she will seek sanctions against former President Donald Trump, his three oldest children and their lawyers for making “demonstrably false” denials in response to the state’s $250 million fraud suit.

entries.title: US Accuses Russia of Breaching the New START Nuclear Arms Treaty
entries.description: Russia is breaching the terms of the New START nuclear-arms reduction treaty by refusing to allow inspectors on its territory and stonewalling US efforts to discuss the issue, the State Department said Tuesday.

entries.title: Biden, Black Caucus Members to Meet on Police Reform After Nichols’s Killing
entries.description: President Joe Biden will host members of the Congressional Black Caucus at the White House on Thursday to discuss police reform legislation as congressional lawmakers look to revisit the issue following the death of Tyre Nichols, a Black man who was fatally beaten by Memphis, Tennessee, police officers.

entries.title: Blinken Departs Mideast, Leaving Behind US Officials to Help Restore Calm
entries.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said American officials will be staying in the Mideast after his departure in an effort to help Israelis and Palestinians reduce tensions following one of the deadliest months in Israel and the West Bank in years.

entries.title: USDA Launches Cattle-Sales Database to Check Meat Giants’ Power
entries.description: The Biden administration introduced a public database on payment terms for private cattle sales, designed to give producers more leverage in negotiating with the four meatpacking giants that dominate US beef processing.

entries.title: Amazon Illegally Resisted NYC Union Drive, Labor Board Judge Says
entries.description: Amazon.com Inc. violated federal labor law as part of its efforts to resist unionization at two facilities in New York City, a National Labor Relations Board judge ruled.

entries.title: US Warships’ Time at Sea Dwindles on Breakdowns as China Challenge Rises
entries.description: US Navy warships have seen fewer days at sea since 2011 because vessels are breaking down more frequently than expected and taking longer to repair, even as the Pentagon struggles to catch up with China’s larger fleet, according to newly disclosed data from congressional analysts.

entries.title: Nearly 80% of Voters in Santos’s NY District Want Him to Resign
entries.description: Almost 80% of the voters in US Representative George Santos’s New York district say the embattled Republican should resign, according to a Newsday/Siena College poll released Tuesday.

entries.title: Ukraine’s Allies Reject Giving Fighter Jets in Blow to Zelenskiy
entries.description: Ukraine’s biggest allies have so far said they won’t send fighter jets to Kyiv, denying a key request from President Volodymyr Zelenskiy ahead of an expected escalation in fighting.

entries.title: UK, Italy, Japan Consider Plan to Oversee New Fighter Jet
entries.description: Italy, Japan and the UK aim to set up an international organization by the end of the year to push through their plans for a next generation fighter jet, according to people familiar with the discussions.

entries.title: Embattled Republican George Santos Won’t Serve on House Committees
entries.description: New York Representative George Santos told his Republican colleagues that he won’t serve on the two committees on which he was assigned.

entries.title: UN Experts Call for War Crimes Probe Into Mali, Wagner Group
entries.description: UN experts called for an independent investigation into possible war crimes by Mali’s army and mercenaries from the Kremlin-linked Wagner Group.

entries.title: Deutsche Bank Settlement on Epstein Oversight to Be Approved
entries.description: A judge said he would approve Deutsche Bank AG’s $26.3 million settlement of a lawsuit that accused the bank of misleading investors about how thoroughly it vetted clients, including Jeffrey Epstein and Russian oligarchs.

entries.title: Pope Francis in Congo to Highlight Conflict Displacing Millions
entries.description: Pope Francis arrived in the Democratic Republic of Congo on a four-day visit to the biggest Roman Catholic community in Africa, where he’ll use his presence to draw attention to conflict and poverty in the country that have displaced more than 5.6 million people.

entries.title: Biden to Press McCarthy on Debt Limit in First Meeting
entries.description: President Joe Biden aims to press House Speaker Kevin McCarthy to commit to preventing the US from defaulting on its debt in a sit-down meeting Wednesday, and to challenge the Republican to release his own detailed spending plan.

entries.title: Kuwait Sees $16.4 Billion Deficit, Looks to Boost Revenue
entries.description: Kuwait unveiled budget proposals that forecast a deficit for the fiscal year starting April 1, despite efforts by the OPEC member to boost revenue booked from independent state entities.

entries.title: Liberian President Points to Economic Gains Ahead of 2023 Vote
entries.description: Liberian economic growth is accelerating and authorities are making progress in stabilizing debt, President George Weah said as he announced plans to seek reelection in October.

entries.title: Silvergate Pressed by US Senators After ‘Evasive’ Responses on FTX
entries.description: A bipartisan group of US senators is pressing Silvergate Capital Corp. over whether it knew about FTX’s alleged misuse of customer funds after the lawmakers found responses to an earlier inquiry to be “evasive and incomplete.”

entries.title: Trump-Backed Dream of a Venezuela Coup Dies With Maduro Gaining Power
entries.description: Opposition leader’s ouster puts Citgo and $1 billion in gold at risk as the pro-democracy movement faces long odds to victory.

entries.title: New York Is Gorging on Fuel Made From Illicit Russian Oil
entries.description: New York is buying an unusually large amount of gasoline and diesel from India — a country that has become a top outlet for sanctioned Russian oil.

entries.title: Angola, Zambia, Congo Set Up Joint Agency to Manage Key Trade Corridor
entries.description: Angola, Zambia and Democratic Republic of Congo agreed to establish a new agency that will oversee the development of a trade corridor to and from the Atlantic Ocean port of Lobito that has the potential to transform how the region’s resources are shipped.

entries.title: Hungary Ousts Hundreds From Top Army Ranks, Defense Chief Says
entries.description: Hungary’s nationalist government ousted hundreds of senior military leaders in the most far-reaching overhaul of the central European nation’s army since it joined the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

entries.title: UK Expects Significant Disruption as Half Million Set to Strike
entries.description: Britons should brace for “significant” disruption on Wednesday, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s spokesman said on Tuesday, as hundreds of thousands of workers prepared to strike across the UK’s railways, schools and civil service.

entries.title: Tesla Received Requests From Justice Department Related to Autopilot
entries.description: Tesla Inc. confirmed it has received requests for documents from the US Justice Department related to driver-assistance features, part of the escalating legal and regulatory scrutiny being given to its technology.

entries.title: Mexico’s Economy Beats Growth Expectations Ahead of Likely Slowdown
entries.description: Latin America’s second-largest economy grew 3.5% in 2022, helped by resilient consumption

entries.title: Adani Appears in Israel, Netanyahu Says More Investment Coming
entries.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu used an appearance by billionaire Gautam Adani at a ceremony on Tuesday to highlight Israel’s plans to expand the reach of its ports.

entries.title: Putin’s War Is Unnerving Russia’s Old Friends
entries.description: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is driving some of its oldest ex-Soviet friends to look for ways to cut dependence on a weakened and increasingly unpredictable regional power.

entries.title: China Is Learning From Putin’s War in Ukraine, NATO Chief Warns
entries.description: Beijing is closely watching Russia’s war in Ukraine and learning lessons that may influence future decisions, NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said, stressing warnings about China’s behavior including its threats toward Taiwan.

entries.title: Croat President Slams the West for ‘Taking’ Kosovo From Serbia
entries.description: Croatia’s President Zoran Milanovic drew a parallel from Russia’s annexation of Crimea to Kosovo’s independence form Serbia, causing an uproar across the Balkans.

entries.title: Orban’s Hungary Seen Most Corrupt in EU, Overtaking Bulgaria
entries.description: Hungary has replaced Bulgaria as the European Union member state perceived to be the most corrupt, according to Transparency International.

entries.title: Biden to Tout Funds for Rail Tunnel Long Sought by NYC Commuters
entries.description: President Joe Biden will take a victory lap Tuesday as officials prepare to begin work on a massive rail plan hard-pressed New York City commuters have waited years for: the Gateway tunnel project.

entries.title: China Blasts Incoming Czech Leader Over Call With Taiwan Leader
entries.description: China lashed out at the Czech Republic after incoming President Petr Pavel spoke with Taiwan leader Tsai Ing-wen two days after he was elected, saying the move amounted to “serious interference” in its affairs.

entries.title: Britain’s Senior Doctors to Consider Whether to Join Strikes
entries.description: Britain’s senior doctors could become the latest health professionals to go on strike as the country is beset by another wave of industrial action.

entries.title: US, South Korea Plan to Bolster Military Drills That Anger Kim
entries.description: The US and South Korea are planning to step up the scale of their joint military exercises, a move that has in the past prompted threats and weapons tests by North Korea.

entries.title: India Vows Fiscal Prudence as Global Risks Weigh on Growth
entries.description: India’s government said it will focus on rebuilding fiscal space lost during the pandemic to counter new risks from a challenging global environment, which has already begun weighing on domestic demand.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Send Figher Jets, Lithuanian President Urges
entries.description: NATO partners must cross yet another red line and send fighter jets and long-rage missiles to Ukraine, Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda said, adding it is vital to act without delay because “the turning point is about to happen.”

entries.title: China and Australia’s Top Trade Officials to Meet Next Week
entries.description: Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao and Australian Trade Minister Don Farrell will meet virtually next week for the first time since a change of government in Canberra, a sign of warming diplomatic and economic ties.

entries.title: Malaysia’s Anwar on Being PM, Divisive Politics and China: Q&A
entries.description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim demanded Goldman Sachs Group Inc. honor its settlement with the government for its role in the 1MDB scandal and vowed to gradually lower the nation’s debt during an interview with Bloomberg Television.

entries.title: Chinese City Turns Quarantine Camp Into Temporary Homes for ‘Skilled Talent’
entries.description: Local governments in China are looking for new uses for the makeshift quarantine facilities built during the pandemic, after years of strict Covid Zero rules left many authorities strapped for cash.

entries.title: Pakistan’s Worst Suicide Bombing in Years Kills 80 at Mosque
entries.description: The worst suicide bombing in over four years tore through a mosque in a high-security compound in northwestern Pakistan’s Peshawar city killing at least 80 people and leaving dozens wounded, hospital and rescue workers said.

entries.title: Thailand Hands Out 95 Million Condoms to Beat Syphilis, Teen Pregnancy
entries.description: Thailand plans to distribute 95 million free condoms to curb sexually transmitted diseases and teen pregnancy as the Southeast Asian nation seeks to promote safe sex ahead of Valentine’s Day.

entries.title: Pro-Brexit Areas Fall Even Further Behind Three Years After Leaving EU
entries.description: Bloomberg UK’s Levelling Up Scorecard shows how constituencies that voted Leave have yet to see many of the promised economic benefits.

entries.title: UK Tumbles in Corruption Index After a Year of Political Scandal
entries.description: The UK slipped down a global corruption ranking, with watchdog Transparency International describing public trust as “worryingly low” after a string of political and public spending scandals. The group also highlighted a lack of progress in Russia, Brazil and Qatar.

entries.title: US Leads World in Health-Care Spending Yet Key Health Outcomes Lag, Study Says
entries.description: The US spends as much as three times more on health care per person as other high-income countries, yet residents are often less likely to visit doctors, according to a report that highlights poor returns for the nation’s large investment.

entries.title: Putin’s War in Ukraine Pushes Ex-Soviet States Toward New Allies
entries.description: The Kremlin ruler’s efforts to restore Russian dominance over its neighbors seem further away than ever as nations build ties with rival powers.

entries.title: France Hit by New Strikes as Opposition to Pension Reform Grows
entries.description: French labor unions are leading a second day of mass strikes and protests on Tuesday against raising the retirement age in a test of the momentum driving defiance to Emmanuel Macron’s signature economic reform.

entries.title: Strike-Hit Britain Is Starting to Look More Like France
entries.description: Mass strikes have marked France’s political landscape for years, while post-Thatcher Britain is known for its more flexible labor market. This week, however, the two countries could look similar as widespread protests are mirrored on either side of the English Channel.

entries.title: Chinese Patrols in Disputed Sea Hit New Peak With Tensions High
entries.description: China’s Coast Guard maintained near-daily patrols at key features across the disputed South China Sea last year, ramping up its presence as tensions over the waterway with Southeast Asian neighbors remain high, new tracking data shows.

entries.title: NZ’s Hipkins Reshuffles Cabinet to Focus on Key Election Issues
entries.description: New Zealand Prime Minister Chris Hipkins announced a cabinet reshuffle that he said will better focus his government on key voter concerns ahead of an October election.

entries.title: Hong Kong’s Lee Rebuffs Calls for Inquiry Into Pandemic Handling
entries.description: Hong Kong’s leader dismissed calls for an independent commission to look into the city’s handling of the Covid pandemic.

entries.title: China Wary as NATO Chief Seeks Stronger Ties on Asian Visit
entries.description: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg is set to meet Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on an Asian tour that has sparked suspicion in China, which is wary of the group’s efforts to build ties with its neighbors.

entries.title: China Tells Dutch It Wants Open Supply Chains Amid US Chip Curbs
entries.description: China told the Netherlands it wants to keep supply chains and trade open, a sign Beijing is trying to find room to maneuver amid a US push to cut it off from advanced chip technology.

entries.title: Lula Brushes Off Germany’s Appeal for Brazil to Send Weapons to Ukraine
entries.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva turned down a German request to send ammunition to Ukraine as part of the international effort to help Kyiv repel the Russian invasion.

entries.title: Europe’s Fossil Fuel Use Is Set to Plummet in 2023, Report Says
entries.description: The amount of electricity produced from burning fossil fuels in the European Union is set to plunge this year as the bloc focuses on renewables to replace energy supplies from Russia.
